newsitem.title: UK: BASF SEES 4 BLN DM PHARMA SALES IN 1997.
newsitem.headline: BASF SEES 4 BLN DM PHARMA SALES IN 1997.

text.p: German chemicals company BASF AG said on Thursday that it expected to generate sales of about four billion marks this year.
At a news conference here BASF chairman Juergen Strube said, "the sales increase will be provided by our own new products."
He expects increases in pharmaceutical sales above market growth in the medium term.
Strube also said that BASF expects final approval to market its meridia drug against obesity related diseases by the end of this year.
Two weeks ago, BASF agreed on a settlement of the lawsuits concerning synthroid, a drug for treating thyroid insufficiency.
Strube said that the agreement which is subject to court approval, will involve 98 million dollars being paid into a settlement fund.
He added that synthroid sales have not been affected as a result of this situation.
